title: Installing @truffle/contract fails if git is not installed
body:
- [ N ] I've asked for help in the [Truffle Gitter](http://gitter.im/Consensys/truffle) before filing this issue.

---------------------------

* Ethereum client: geth 1.9.21-stable / solc 0.7.1+commit.f4a555be.Linux.g++
* Truffle version (`truffle version`): v5.1.45
* node version (`node --version`): v10.19.0
* npm version (`npm --version`): 6.14.4

Hm, any reason why you need that specific version?

I just tried latest and 4.0.33 and both install (but I'm on a Mac). Could you try installing latest and see if that works for you?

Apologies, I had started with the latest version but when that didn't work I started trying other versions and copied the wrong output. I've updated the Issue above with what I started with.

I'm trying to get this working on Ubuntu 20.04. I have not tried on my Mac yet.
Oh darn. Thought we got rid of this problem. Looks like @truffle/contract needs git installed. We'll look into fixing this, but in the meantime, it should work if you install git first.
Many thanks, just to confirm installing 'git' first fixed this. You could close this for me but would be good if you could fix this automatically for others.
@whittlem Thanks for confirming. We are going to try and fix this, we'll leave this issue open for now to track the problem.
We're not sure what's causing this but will look into it, thanks @whittlem!

Hello @moyu597, your errors are not related to `git` installation status. According to the errors, the `npm` command failed because of permission errors. Usually, this is because `sudo` was previously used to elevate privileges when installing node, or running `npm`. 

You'll have to fix your environment before proceeding. Start with running `npm doctor` and followup on its output. Good luck!
